reviews.text: Stayed there for 2 nights with my mother to show her Vienna. Location is about 15 walking minutes from Stephansdom on an extremely busy shopping street (Mariahilfer-Strasse). U-Bahn right in front, Tram-Station about 5 minutes and Westbahnhof about 8 minutes walking. Great for shopping. Small hotel, hard to find amongst all the surrounding shops. Rooms are positively HUGE (Suites) and well equipped. Very comfy beds! The only negative point is the charge of 18 Euros for 24 hours of Wifi...
reviews.title: Shopping Paradise
A Great fun stay in Vienna
reviews.text: Otherwise it comes highly recommended. Good value for money too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there about 1 year ago but I still wanna give a fair compliment to this hotel because our stay here contributed to our great fun when visiting Vienna. The first night stay was not that pleasant though. The room we had been given facing the street was very warm and I couldn't sleep due to noises from outside/street. They gave us another room for the other 3 nigths and it was perfect. The hotel is on perfect location (2 min walk to subway, 5 min walk to train station, 20 min walk to Hafburg and it's in the middle of my wife's shoping street). The room we had is very spacious, modern, just like a small apartment. Breakfast was excellent on the balcony..and they also gave us all the minibar (except the wine) for free.
reviews.title: Not quite what you imagine when reading recommendations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed for two nights in NH Atterseehaus Vienna, during our road trip in Europe and we were planning on the go where next and where to stay. Unfortunately for Vienna it wasn't our best choice. Seeing their website and pictures and reading some reviews I went there with some expectations. The room is big, better say it is a small apartment, with bedroom and living room, you have the basic services and is pretty clean, but horribly decorated and looking like an average three stars hotel.
reviews.title: Simply perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although they brag about their custom made beds, nor me or my partner could sleep during those two nights as we simply didn't feel comfortable in it. You simply cannot find the right sleeping position and the bed is shacking like earthquake at the smallest move or turn.
reviews.title: Our desires and inquiries have been completely satisfied.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights.tue-fri.I had looked at alot of other hotels ,and price wise this was very good compared to the others which were further out etc.
reviews.title: great allround!

reviews.text: Very friendly reception.Apartment type hotel(loads of room),and the position on one of the two main shopping streets was brilliant,directly outside a tube station.Which is paramount of you want to sightsee.The tube's a great way to get around and reccomend as a must the vienna 3 day card which you can buy from the reception for 18.50,whic not only allows you to travel on all the transport other than the cat,but saves you a good euro or so on each attraction you see.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: had a sauna with a stepper and cross trainer that counted as the gym,but i suppose you do'nt go to vienna to work out.
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.text: mini bar is expensive but you get anything you want from the surrounding supermarkets.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is 16 euro per person(for some reason we thought it was free)but is a great afair withy everything you could want.Although a odd breafast out maybe good to contrast.But the breakfast staff were very friendly and quick.And the braekfast room had a good view of vienna.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Big room with couch and microwave

reviews.text: I stayed 6 months ago but the hotel was absolutely fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay - I Would Reccomend!

reviews.text: From Vienna Airport you get the 'CAT' train from the airport to the city centre. Me and my sister went to information and they were able to tell me where to go for the hotel. I must admit the airport told us to a stop too far...most Londoners will recognise that Oxford Circus and Bond Street is one massive road with 2 underground stations on - and this was the same (sorry this is the best way I can explain). The airport told us to get off at Louise (I believe) when in fact it should have been the stop before. I thought I would rectify this for other travellers!
reviews.title: exelent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After we eventually found it we were so impressed, we arrived in the evening and I was babbling onto the hotel about doing a Mozart Orchester evening and the receptionist was so helpful and very patient with my many questions! Me and my sister did the Vienna bus tour and he kindly told us what station we would need to get to - being so close to the metro we were both happy to use this to get around. We were so on the move but we did manage to cram in some shopping and the MacDonald's nearby (virtually opposite) allowed us to grab quick food when we needed to.
reviews.title: Excellent service, average appointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel and although I thought it was pricey it was all you can eat and it did set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Great - Just Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would really recommended this hotel and the city Vienna to go to - there is so much to do and it is a beautiful city!
reviews.title: great location, simple decoratioin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on a lively street with shops and restaurants. The subway station is right in front of the hotel (a few stations away from the major sights). You can walk easily from the main train station. The rooms are very very spacious, as a matter of fact I think they are all suites, with a kitchen corner and everything. We really enjoyd our stay there.
reviews.title: Roomy, walking distance from train station and in front of subway station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The NH Atterseehaus is an Aparthotel, giving you the convenience of a hotel with the space of a small apartment. After 2 months of hotel rooms, this was bliss! Even better, it was very reasonable in price, especially considering its location.
reviews.title: What pleasure to have some space after so many tiny hotel rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted when we opened our room to find a separate living area as well as a larger than average bedroom and good sized bathroom with separate toilet. The bed was especially comfortable and we slept very well.
reviews.title: Such spacious rooms, it felt more like we were at home than staying in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, on Mariahilferstrasse about 2 blocks from the west Bahnhof. A great breakfast was included, and there was a microwave if you wanted just a snack instead of using the numerous cafes/restaurants nearby. There were also several supermarkets handy.
reviews.title: No free internet connection

reviews.text: A great alternative to a hotel, especially if you are staying for a few days or more.
reviews.title: Lovely place!
